intro: Heptapleurum ellipticum var. obliquinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined elliptic heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with a distinct, narrow venation pattern. The plant is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of China and Vietnam. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a showy display during the spring and summer months.
